page.title: 24Hospital Care
page.content:
Kingsmill hospital now contains a full A&E department and a helipad in the nature reserve to the rear of the hospital. It also has its own radio station called Millside and has been operating for over 25 years. In 2001 Kingsmill joined Sherwood Forest hospital NHS foundation trust along with Newark general and Ashfield & Mansfield district hospital, then in 2007 it became Sherwood Forest foundation trust. It provides healthcare services for around 300,000 people Kingsmill is having a Â£320 million face lift with the new buildings incorporating a diagnostic treatment centre, maternity service including neonatal and Sherwood birthing unit. The Dukeries centre that dates back to the 1970’s cannot be demolished because it was gift donated and it states in a cluse that it cannot be demolished.
